intro: Saussurea yoshinagae, commonly known as the Yoshinaga saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of central and western Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root systems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, woody fruits known as cypsela. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
